What is the Net Worth of Susan Saint James in 2024?

As of 2024, Susan Saint James‘s net worth is estimated to be around $60 million. This impressive figure places her among the ranks of notable rich TV actresses.

Susan’s wealth has been accumulated through her successful television career, notable film roles, and smart business ventures.

How Did Susan Saint James Accumulate Her Wealth?

Susan Saint James accumulated her wealth through a diverse career in television and film. She gained early fame with her role in The Name of the Game, which earned her an Emmy Award.

Her notable roles in McMillan & Wife and Kate & Allie further cemented her status in the entertainment industry. These TV series provided a significant portion of her earnings.

Additionally, her film roles in Outlaw Blues, Love at First Bite, and How to Beat the High Cost of Living contributed to her wealth. Susan also made guest appearances in popular shows like The Drew Carey Show and Law & Order: SVU, adding to her income.

Her business venture, Seedling and Pip, and her involvement in charitable activities, particularly with the Special Olympics, showcase her diverse interests and income sources.

Susan’s Career Highlights

Susan’s career highlights include her early roles in Fame is the Name of the Game and Ironside.

Her breakthrough came with The Name of the Game, where she played Peggy Maxwell. This role won her an Emmy and made her a household name.

Her portrayal of Sally McMillan in McMillan & Wife brought her further acclaim and multiple Emmy nominations. Later, she starred in Kate & Allie, another beloved TV series, earning more Emmy nods.

Awards and Recognitions

Susan Saint James has received several awards and recognitions throughout her career. She won an Emmy Award for her role in The Name of the Game and received multiple nominations for her performances in McMillan & Wife and Kate & Allie.

Additionally, she was honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2008, celebrating her contributions to television and film.

Susan’s Activism and Philanthropy

Susan is well-known for her activism, particularly with the Special Olympics, an organization she has supported since 1972.

She has served on their board and has been actively involved in various charitable endeavors. Her commitment to philanthropy highlights her dedication to giving back to the community.
